intro: Phlomoides schugnanica, commonly known as the Schugnan mountain phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, narrow leaves, and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
